name: ER Bradley's Saloon
address: 104 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: The anchor of Clematis Street and probably the most iconic bar in West Palm. ER Bradley's has a massive waterfront patio, live music most nights, and the kind of crowd that ranges from suits to flip-flops. Been here forever and it's not going anywhere.

name: O'Shea's Irish Pub
address: 531 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: Proper Irish pub on Clematis with dark wood, Guinness on draft, and live Celtic music on weekends. The trivia nights are competitive and the bartenders know how to pour a pint. A Clematis Street staple.

name: Roxy's Pub
address: 309 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: Clematis Street's best dive bar. Cheap drinks, pool tables, a killer jukebox, and karaoke nights that get absolutely unhinged. No pretension, no dress code, just a good time.

name: Respectable Street
address: 518 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: A legendary indie venue that's been booking underground acts since the 80s. Respectable Street is where you go for DJs, indie bands, and themed nights that actually have personality. If you know, you know.

name: Rocco's Tacos & Tequila Bar
address: 224 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: Tableside guacamole, a tequila list that goes on for pages, and an energy level that's always turned up. Rocco's is the loud, fun Mexican spot on Clematis that everyone ends up at eventually. The margaritas hit different.

name: Hullabaloo
address: 517 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: Farm-to-table gastropub on Clematis with a menu that changes constantly and cocktails made by people who care. Sunday brunch is excellent. One of the best restaurants on the street and it doubles as a great bar.

name: Sub-Culture
address: 509 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: An intimate lounge and performance space that books comedy, jazz, DJs, and everything in between. Sub-Culture is the more chill sibling of Respectable Street and the cocktails are a step up. Perfect for a more curated night out.

name: Kapow Noodle Bar
address: 519 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: Pan-Asian street food with a craft cocktail program that goes hard. The ramen is legit, the bao buns are addictive, and the bar scene on weekends turns into a full party. Order the dragon punch bowl for the table.

name: The Blind Monk
address: 410 Evernia St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: A cozy wine and craft beer bar tucked off Clematis that feels like a secret. Great charcuterie, curated beer list, and a vibe that's perfect for a quiet date night or catching up with a friend. No TVs, no nonsense.

name: Lost Weekend
address: 327 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: A bar with arcade games, pinball, and pool tables. Lost Weekend is where you go when you want to drink and play. The vibe is fun without trying too hard and the drinks are cheap. Great pregame spot.

name: Blue Martini
address: 550 S Rosemary Ave #250, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: The dressed-up option at Rosemary Square with live music, DJs, and a scene that skews a little older and a lot more polished. The happy hour is actually one of the best deals for the quality of cocktails. Gets packed on weekends.

name: Norton Museum of Art
address: 1450 S Dixie Hwy, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: World-class art museum with a permanent collection that rivals cities ten times this size. The sculpture garden is beautiful and Friday nights they stay open late with special programming. Free admission on Fridays.

name: Grandview Public Market
address: 1401 Clare Ave, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: A food hall with multiple vendors under one roof. Great for brunch with options ranging from acai bowls to tacos to craft coffee. The space is bright, the food is solid, and it's the kind of place where everyone in your group can get something different.

name: West Palm Beach GreenMarket
address: 101 S Flagler Dr, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: The biggest and best farmers market in the county, right on the waterfront. Over 100 vendors every Saturday morning from October to April. The baked goods, fresh produce, and prepared food are all excellent. Arrive early, it gets crowded.

name: Mounts Botanical Garden
address: 531 N Military Trail, West Palm Beach, FL 33415
description: 14 acres of tropical gardens that feel like a different world. The butterfly garden and rainforest section are the highlights. Peaceful, beautiful, and way less crowded than you'd expect. Great for a morning walk or a low-key date.

name: Manatee Lagoon
address: 6000 N Flagler Dr, West Palm Beach, FL 33407
description: A free eco-discovery center where you can watch manatees gather in the warm water outflow during winter months. The observation deck gives you a great view and the staff knows everything about these gentle giants. Peak manatee season is November through March.

name: Okeeheelee Park
address: 7715 Forest Hill Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL 33413
description: Massive county park with a BMX track, disc golf, fishing lakes, nature trails, and a water ski facility. If you want to be outdoors and active without going to the beach, this is the spot. Bring your bike or just walk the trails.

name: Rosemary Square
address: 700 S Rosemary Ave, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
description: The open-air shopping and dining district formerly known as CityPlace. Good restaurants, a movie theater, and a fountain plaza where they host events. It's the central hub of downtown West Palm and a solid place to start a night out.
